newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenya's T-Bill rates higher at weekly auction.
newsitem.headline: Kenya's T-Bill rates higher at weekly auction.

text.p: Kenya's treasury bill rates reversed a downward trend seen since beginning of October and rose at the weekly treasury bill auction on Thursday, Central Bank of Kenya officials said.

The bank said it accepted bids at an average interest rate of 21.566 percent from 21.406 percent last week on its 91-day main category of treasury bills, while on the 28-day category, it accepted at 16.230 percent from 15.988 percent.
Out of 5.221 billion bids tendered, the central bank accepted bids worth 4.591 billion shillings.
Volumes accepted in the 28-day category eased to 129.9 million shillings from 156.4, while on the 91-day category, volumes accepted increased marginally to 4.460 billion shillings from 4.192 billion.
In the 182-day category, the bank accepted bids worth 900,000 shillings from 5.2 million at a non-competitive rate.
The auction is held every Thursday.
The central bank invited tenders for treasury bills worth seven billion shillings for Friday next week.
